questiontext.text: Values of \(\sin\theta,\, \cos\theta\) and \(\tan\theta\) can of course be obtained by calculator. When entering the angle in degrees ( e.g. \(30^\circ\)) the calculator must be in degree mode. (Typically this is ensured by pressing the DRG button until 'DEG' is shown on the display). The keystrokes for \(\sin 30^\circ\) are usually simply \(\fbox{sin} \quad \fbox{30}\) or, on some calculators, \(\fbox{30} \quad \fbox{sin}\) perhaps followed by \(\fbox{=}.\)
